intro: Paepalanthus spirophorus, commonly known as the spiral spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spiral-shaped inflorescence. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers surrounded by colorful, fleshy structures called cyathia. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique morphology, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
